communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All email correspondences (including email attachments), meeting minutes, and presentation documents from meetings between NYSDERA officials and ICF energy consultant Maurice Oldham that contain one or more of the following search terms:

> Renewable Natural Gas
> RNG

Please limit the search window to email correspondences and meetings that occurred between January 1, 2020 and April 1, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of consulting firm ICF’s contract with the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority that resulted in the publication of the 2021 report titled  “Potential of Renewable Natural Gas in New York State” (NYSERDA Report Number 21-34).

A list of names of ICF contractors involved in NYSERDA Report Number 21-34.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All email correspondences (including attachments) with individuals whose email addresses end in @ICF.com that contain one or more of the following search terms: 

“Climate Affordability Study” 
“Cap and Invest” (or "Cap-and-Invest") 
“Renewable natural gas”
“RNG”

Any meeting minutes, notes, or presentation documents from meetings with ICF contractors that contain one or more of the following search terms: 

“Climate Affordability Study” 
“Cap and Invest” (or "Cap-and-Invest") 
“Renewable natural gas”
“RNG”

Please limit the search to emails sent or received between January 1, 2023 and December 20, 2023 and meetings that took place within the same timeframe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

title: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

> A copy of the contract with strategic consulting firm ICF that resulted in the publication of the "Climate Affordability Study" published in December 2023 to inform New York State’s forthcoming Cap-and-Invest Program.
> A list of names of ICF contractors involved in the preparation of the Climate Affordability Study.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

title: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Department of Environmental Conservation)
